AL6061-T6.name: Aluminum 6061-T6
AL6061-T6.notes: Most common general-purpose aluminum. Excellent machinability and corrosion resistance.

AL7075-T6.name: Aluminum 7075-T6
AL7075-T6.notes: High-strength aerospace aluminum. Poor weldability. Stress corrosion cracking susceptible.

Steel_1018.name: Steel 1018 (Low Carbon)
Steel_1018.notes: General-purpose low carbon steel. Easy to weld and machine. Case-hardenable.

Steel_4140.name: Steel 4140 (Alloy)
Steel_4140.notes: Versatile alloy steel. Through-hardenable. Good fatigue resistance. Preheat before welding.

SS304.name: Stainless Steel 304
SS304.notes: Most common stainless steel. Excellent corrosion resistance. Work-hardens during machining.

SS316.name: Stainless Steel 316
SS316.notes: Marine-grade stainless. Superior corrosion resistance to 304, especially chloride environments.

Ti-6Al-4V.name: Titanium 6Al-4V (Grade 5)
Ti-6Al-4V.notes: Most common titanium alloy. Excellent strength-to-weight ratio. Difficult to machine -- low thermal conductivity.

Gray_Cast_Iron.name: Gray Cast Iron (Class 30)
Gray_Cast_Iron.notes: Excellent vibration damping. Graphite flakes act as chip breakers. Brittle -- fails without plastic deformation.

ABS.name: ABS (Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene)
ABS.notes: Most common 3D printing and injection molding plastic. Good impact resistance. UV-sensitive.

Nylon_6_6.name: Nylon 6/6 (Polyamide)
Nylon_6_6.notes: Excellent wear resistance and low friction. Absorbs moisture which affects dimensions. Glass-filled grades are more stable.

PEEK.name: PEEK (Polyether Ether Ketone)
PEEK.notes: High-performance engineering plastic. Excellent chemical resistance. Withstands 250C continuous. Used in aerospace and medical.

Acetal_Delrin.name: Acetal (Delrin/POM)
Acetal_Delrin.notes: Excellent dimensional stability among plastics. Low friction, good wear resistance. Ideal for gears, bearings, and bushings.

metadata.notes: Properties are typical values for standard grades. Actual values vary by supplier and heat treatment.
